episodes.title: Why You Should Figure Out Your Brand, Fast
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Maap sells premium cycling apparel designed in Melbourne, Australia. On today's episode, Maap's Oliver Cousins explains why he invested in their brand identity right from the start.

episodes.title: How to Court VC Funding to Scale Your Business
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: On today's episode, Dah Makan's Jonathan Weins explains how they courted Angel and VC funding, and grew their startup to over 40 employees.

episodes.title: Entering TV's Shark Tank (But Not For the Reasons You Think)
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Deals! Sharks! Coozies! On today's episode, Freaker USA's Lauren Krakauskas shares why they went on ABC's Shark Tank, when a deal was the last thing on their minds.

episodes.title: Building a Bigger Business
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: On a special episode of Shopify Masters, Goldie Blox's Debbie Sterling talks about winning Shopify’s 3rd Build a Business competition, and her role as a mentor in the upcoming Build a Bigger Business.

episodes.title: You Don't Have to Know it All to Make it Scale
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Kisstixx sells a lip balm that adds a little chemistry to every kiss. On today’s episode, Kisstixx's Dallas Robinson explains how he used online ads to drive traffic to... offline retail stores. Plus, we debut a new format!

episodes.title: The Power of Crowds
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Robo wants to make 3D printing accessible for everyone. On today's episode, Robo's Braydon Moreno shares how he uses video ads to power a $4.7 million business.

episodes.title: Finesse the Pug (Through Facebook Ads)
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: On today's episode, you’ll learn how The Passionate Pug's Kwaku Nornoo used Facebook to launch a six figure business.

episodes.title: A Branding Dilemma
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Worldwide Cyclery wants to redefine what it means to be a bike shop. On today’s episode you’ll learn why Worldwide lists a handful of items on their site, when they actually sit on an inventory of over 20,000 products.

episodes.title: When it Comes to Traffic, Less is S'More
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: Edoughble is not your cookie-cutter cookie dough company. On today’s (delicious) episode, Edoughble's John and Rana Lustyan share how they found success by focusing on smaller traffic.

episodes.title: Walk Like an Animal (Lover), Talk Like an Animal (Lover)
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary: DoToly makes affordable animal jewellery, gifts, and home decor. On today's episode DoToly's Cindy Chan shares how  success comes from speaking your customer’s language.

In this episode you'll learn:


How to survey people in person to validate a product or business idea.
How to differentiate yourself in a competitive marketplace.
How to find and hire people that are smarter than you.

episodes.title: FindlayHats.com Drove $28K from 1 Viral Reddit Post
episodes.author: Shopify
episodes.summary:
In this episode you’ll learn how an entrepreneur drove $28,000 from 1 viral reddit post.

In this episode you'll learn:


How to validate a product on Instagram.
How to balance life as a freelancer while launching a product business.



3. What are magic moments and how to create them for your customer.

episodes.title: Cotopaxi.com Uses In-Person 24-Hour Events To Market Their Vision and Brand

episodes.summary:

In this episode you'll learn:


How to attract smart people to your team.

3. How to prepare to launch your own in-person events.

episodes.title: Your Brand’s Competitive Edge Doesn’t Have To Be In Your Product

episodes.summary:

What red flags to look for when sourcing products overseas.

3. How to improve your decision making to start making decisions faster.

episodes.title: Bee-High.com Built and Marketed A Side Business Using Tumblr

episodes.summary:

In this episode you'll learn:


How and why to get deeply involved with communities before launching your business.

episodes.title: Persistence, Not Passion, Helped GetFitBook.com Sell Over Half a Million Books

episodes.summary:
On today’s podcast you’ll learn from an entrepreneur that argues that persistence is more important than passion and how it helped her sell over half a million books.

What is analysis paralysis and how to combat it.

3. Why you should feature your customers rather than your products when getting PR.

episodes.title: The Formula LuxyHair.com Used To Grow a 2.8 Million Subscriber YouTube Channel

episodes.summary:

episodes.summary:
